Package edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter

Interface EntityInterface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HPEntityInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Actor, DeathEater, Dementor, Dumbledore, Entity, HPActor, HPEntity, HPLegend, Player, Potion, Sword, TestActor, Wand
    public interface EntityInterface
    Interface for creating Entities.
    See Also:
    Entity

    • Method Detail

      • getShortDescription

        java.lang.String getShortDescription()
        Returns the short description of the Entity
        Returns:
        a short string describing the Entity

      • getLongDescription

        java.lang.String getLongDescription()
        Returns the long description of the Entity. Long Descriptions usually provide more detail than the short Descriptions.
        Returns:
        a longer string describing the Entity

      • setShortDescription

        void setShortDescription​(java.lang.String shortDescription)
        Sets the short description
        Parameters:
        shortDescription - a short string describing the Entity, suitable for display

      • setLongDescription

        void setLongDescription​(java.lang.String longDescription)
        Sets the long description. Long Descriptions usually provide more detail than the short Descriptions and must be suitable for display.
        Parameters:
        longDescription - a longer string describing the Entity.

      • tick

        <L extends Location> void tick​(L loc)
        By default, Entities do nothing on a tick. Override this method if you want an Entity to respond to the passage of time, e.g. by displaying a message or changing state.
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location of the Entity

      • say

        void say​(java.lang.String message)
        Output a message to the Entity's MessageRenderer.

        This message would be displayed on the View (an implementation of GridRenderer)

        Parameters:
        message - the String to display
        See Also:
        GridRenderer

      • addAffordance

        void addAffordance​(Affordance a)
        Add an Affordance to the set of Affordances the Entity manifests
        Parameters:
        a - the new Affordance

      • removeAffordance

        void removeAffordance​(Affordance a)
        Remove an Affordance from the set of Affordances this Entity manifests

        This method does nothing if the Entity doesn't manifest the Affordance a

        Parameters:
        a - the Affordance to remove

      • getAffordances

        Affordance[] getAffordances()
        Generate and return an array of references to the Affordances of this Entity.
        Returns:
        an array of references to this Entity's Affordances
